meta.title: Frequently Asked Questions
meta.description: Common questions and answers about the platform

categories.name: Getting Started
categories.description: Questions about setting up and starting

categories.name: API & Integration
categories.description: Questions about the API and integrations

faqs.question: What is this platform?
faqs.answer: This is a sample documentation platform built with Docusaurus. Replace this content with information about your actual product or service.

faqs.question: Who is this platform for?
faqs.answer: This platform is designed for developers, technical writers, and teams who need comprehensive documentation. Customize this answer for your target audience.

faqs.question: How do I get started?
faqs.answer: To get started, follow our Getting Started guide in the documentation. It covers installation, configuration, and your first steps with the platform.

faqs.question: What are the system requirements?
faqs.answer: The platform requires Node.js 20 or higher. For detailed requirements, check the deployment guide.

faqs.question: How does API authentication work?
faqs.answer: The API uses bearer token authentication. You can generate API tokens from your account settings. Include the token in the Authorization header of your requests.

faqs.question: What are the API rate limits?
faqs.answer: API rate limits depend on your plan. Free tier: 100 requests/minute. Pro tier: 1000 requests/minute. Enterprise: Unlimited.

faqs.question: Why am I getting a 500 error?
faqs.answer: A 500 error indicates a server-side issue. Check your request format, ensure all required fields are provided, and verify your authentication token is valid.

faqs.question: How can I get support?
faqs.answer: For support, you can: 1) Check our documentation, 2) Search existing GitHub issues, 3) Open a new issue on GitHub, or 4) Contact support@example.com for enterprise customers.
